heading.title: <h1>-<h6> - Heading Elements
heading.heading: Heading Elements
content: HTML provides six levels of heading elements: <h1> through <h6>. <h1> is the most important and largest, while <h6> is the least important and smallest.
Headings help organize content, improve accessibility, and provide structure for both users and search engines.
Search engines use the headings to index the structure and content of your web pages.
Users often skim a page by its headings. It is important to use headings to show the document structure.
Use <h1> for the main title of the page (only once per page), and use <h2> to <h6> for sub-sections and further subdivisions.

Each heading level has a different default size and boldness, making the document hierarchy visually clear. By default, <h1> is the largest and <h6> is the smallest. You can change the size of any heading using CSS, for example: h2 { font-size: 2rem; }.
Example: A blog post might use <h1> for the post title, <h2> for section headings, and <h3> for sub-sections within those sections.

examples.label: All Heading Levels
examples.code:
This is an h1 heading

This is an h2 heading

This is an h3 heading

This is an h4 heading

This is an h5 heading
This is an h6 heading

heading.note: Note: Use HTML headings for headings only. Don't use headings to make text BIG or bold.

editor.initialHtml:
This is an h1 heading

This is an h2 heading

This is an h3 heading

This is an h4 heading

This is an h5 heading
This is an h6 heading

paragraph.title: - Paragraph Element
paragraph.heading:
HTML

Element
paragraph.note:
Note: Paragraphs are for blocks of text. Don't use

for headings or lists.
content:
The

element defines a paragraph of text. It is a block-level element and automatically adds space before and after itself.
Paragraphs are used to group related sentences and make your content easier to read.

You can use multiple

elements to separate different ideas or topics.

examples.label:
Basic

Example
examples.code: This is a paragraph of text in HTML.

editor.initialHtml:
This is a paragraph in HTML.

Paragraphs help structure your content.
